alert.note: Alert for Scott (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 31 at 12:08PM CDT until July 31 at 4:30PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Campbell and Scott. * WHEN...Until 415 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 106 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rain showers could move across the area and produce up to an additional 1 inch of rain. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oneida, Jellico, Winfield, Ketchen, Elk Valley and Indian Mountain State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
